alert.note: Alert for Benewah; Bonner; Boundary; Kootenai; Latah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 10 at 5:31AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...MULTIPLE ROUNDS OF RAIN FOR THE CASCADES AND FOR THE IDAHO PANHANDLE AND THE BLUE MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHEAST WASHINGTON THROUGH MONDAY... Several rounds of rain are expected through Monday across the region. One to one-and-a-half inches of rain have already fallen on the Cascade crest during the past 24 hours, with another inch possible as rain picks up again Friday afternoon and evening. This will lead to continued rises on area creeks and streams. The Stehekin River is already in flood at Stehekin and will likely remain elevated through early next week. The Okanogan River will also rise through the weekend into early next week. A round of heavier rain will occur tonight into Saturday in southeast Washington and northern Idaho, with widespread totals of 0.5 to 1.5 inches possible by Saturday evening. Another round of rain is expected Sunday night and Monday. Storm total rainfall of 2 or more inches is possible. Area creeks and streams will rise through the weekend into early next week, including the St. Joe River. Swift current and cold water will be potential hazards for recreation along rivers and streams this weekend into next week. Minor rock slides may also occur in steep terrain. Burn scars will be particularly susceptible to mud and rock slides.
